title: GT 4.0 GridFTP : User's Guide

section.title: Introduction
section.para: The GridFTP User's Guide provides general end user-oriented information.

section.title: Basic command line
section.para: For those of you who don't want the details, but just want the "rules of thumb" on how to get started, the following options will normally give acceptable performance.
The source/destination URLs will normally be one of the following:

listitem.simpara: file:///path/to/my/file if you are accessing a file on a file system accessible by the host on which you are running your client.
gsiftp://hostname/path/to/remote/file if you are accessing a file from a GridFTP server.

section.title: Putting files
section.para: One of the most basic tasks in GridFTP is to "put" files, i.e., move a file from your file system to the server.
